website_summaries.verdict: This is the top-of-the-line model, offering parents a modern, streamlined design for secure, easy access to baby.
pros: The HALO Bassinest gets our top rating for its sturdy swiveling design and adjustable height that make caring for baby safe and convenient
Includes a nightlight, soothing sounds, and vibration
cons: This model has storage pockets instead of a lower shelf, and they don't hold many items

customer_reviews.title: Do not feel safe with this product however return window closed prior to using.
customer_reviews.text: Bassinet tilts unevenly when baby is placed in it no matter how baby is situated. This caused 6 week old baby to semi roll up againts side of bassinet. otherwise babies head is always sloping down.
customer_reviews.author: Guenter Sengel

customer_reviews.title: Baby constantly rolling off center
customer_reviews.text: I have only one problem with this bassinet, but it prevents me from using it at all. The bassinet wobbles, it is always tilted, and baby constantly rolls off into the side. The slope is pretty obvious, the level in the picture is to demonstrate the incline.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Almeida

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet is Great for newborn. It allowed us to cosleep but not put the baby in any danger. It was awesome! However at 6 weeks we noticed baby wont sleep 3 hours straight at night anymore on the bassinet but will if we put him on his crib. He doesnt seem to be comfortable on the bassinet anymore. We have decided to get rid of it since we want whats best for the baby. However it was so beneficial during the first 6 weeks (i had a csection) that to me it was worth it. You cant put a price on being comfortable after surgery while caring for a newborn.
customer_reviews.author: Marrero Downing

customer_reviews.title: NOT LEVEL -Not worth the hype or the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s not worth it- I really wanted to love this because of all the hype, however once you raise the bassinet higher it makes it uneven (NOT LEVEL) to the point where my newborn was rolling and slanting to one side!!! I have to use the mysnuggly insert and keep it at the lowest position just to make this bassinet work! Also, the sounds and vibration are run on batteries, so make sure you have a Costco stock of batteries because it drains them every week ( we just stopped using that feature). all in all- if you want an unleveled product and to buy a $50 insert purchase this bassinet!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: BIG FEET!
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet is awesome if you are looking for a place for baby to sleep safely in your room. The light is just bright enough to check on baby, but not wake him... however the feet base are very large!! We have a large master bedroom and my husband still stubs his toes on the base, so if you have a small bedroom this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: This is a Must Have, Specially after a C-Section!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for newborns, specially if you got a c-section. It’s really easy to install it. It doesn’t take a lot of space. I think the pad and the volume need some improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Amauris Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings on this. It’s really nice but I don’t think it’s for everyone. My baby really did t like it the first month. I think it’s too open and scary for them after being snuggled in the womb for 9 months. Now that she is two months she dies a little better. She needs to be asleep or almost asleep when put in. We added a two pads to it and put it on a slight incline and that made a difference as well. Also very disappointed with the battery life of the functions. It would be nice if it could be plugged in or if the batteries werent drained so quickly
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J

customer_reviews.title: Tripping Hazard Design Flaw - should be recalled completely.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I can not recommend the Halo Bassinet. In the few days I’ve had it, the grandmother of my son tripped on one of the legs and nearly fell on top of him. I a toddler had run and trip and bang her head against the floor because of it. Inherently, there is a design flaw where in order for it to swivel safely in 360 degrees, it has to have wide foot print of large legs to make it stable. The problem is that they become completely tripping hazard. For a product that is designed for babies, the legs can trip an unsuspecting parent. This product should be recalled completely.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Leung

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super convenient to use by the bed. It's too heavy to lug from room to room if you have limited mobility, but nice and stable if you only keep it by the bed. The cover removes so you can run it through The wash, but watch out for the Velcro. It snagged the mesh and caused some pulling, but the damage was cosmetic. The light has 2 settings, the music is soothing, the vibration is great. I also appreciate the nursing timer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product that my son won't use.
customer_reviews.text: My main reason for a mediocre review isn't so much the product but how it worked for my family. The legs were longer than I was expecting which made it very difficult to move around our small house. It functions as described, no issues there. If my son was okay with sleeping in it at all I would have given a 4 star but as is he cries almost as soon as I lay him down, even if he's completely asleep he wakes up with half an hour. Very sturdy product though, no safety concerns at all with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Quality deal!
customer_reviews.text: We love this bassinet! And I got it for $100 cheaper on Amazon than I could find anywhere else and I looked everywhere!!! The nightlight on this thing comes in handy and way it swivels next to the bed is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Lou

customer_reviews.title: My child refuses to sleep in this
customer_reviews.text: We had a lot of issues with this bassinet. If it is swiveled off the base at all, it tilts downward, which means baby pressed against mesh. Unfortunately we have a platform bed. It does NOT work with a platform bed. We have a drafty bedroom too. It's just an all around not good fit for us with this baby =\ She's never slept in it,and she sleeps in this cheap portable bassinet every night. She's four months old, for the record.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: As far as the bassinet part goes, it’s pretty standard. The swivel feature is very convenient but the legs take up so much space that I trip over them constantly. I’d also note that the vibration goes back and forth between making a very loud noise like some piece of plastic is vibrating against another piece. It’ll start and stop randomly which isn’t exactly conducive to baby staying asleep. The night light is also VERY bright so again it isn’t conducive to using and not interrupting sleep. Overall I think if I could do it over I would have gone with a less expensive option because this one doesn’t seem worth the price tag with the faults it does have.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Some good features, but bed is tilted.
customer_reviews.text: The best features are the height, the swivel, and the light. The vibration and sounds don’t do much for my baby, and there’s nothing special about the sleep surface that makes the Halo superior to a Pack N Play. I agree with other reviewers that the basket appears to be tilted away from the side with the pedestal (which I would consider to be a design flaw). I place my baby on the pedestal side of the mattress and every time she ends up with her face in the mesh on the OTHER side of the basket, which of course wakes her up. I would probably try a different co-sleeper if I had it to do over again.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Read great things about this
customer_reviews.text: Read great things about this. Slightly bulkier than I anticipated but sturdy. Unfortunately, when we brought baby home, her weight in the bassinet somehow affected the batteries in the soothing center so when the vibration feature turned on the batteries would move and then it would not work. The customer support was very helpful and prompt but there was still a delay because I was a new mom and trying to juggle everything was a little difficult. By the time we tried to use it with her, she hated it, won’t sleep more than 10 minutes in there. So for us it was a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not level.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, you can walk right into this thing and it won’t budge. But the rotate/swivel feature is lopsided. The long end hangs noticeably lower than the short end. If you don’t plan on using that feature at all you might be fine, otherwise your baby could end up with their feet higher than their head when they sleep. Not impressed. For the price, this thing shouldn’t have such a (potentially fatal) flaw. Also the upgrade with the music/vibrations seems very poor quality, more like an aftermarket add-on than an upgrade designed by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this bassinet! It fits perfectly over my bed so I can pull my baby close to me and be able to watch him sleep. It swivels in and out to make it easy to get out of bed. The light is a life saver for peaking at him and just enough light for me to nurse him in the middle of the night. And my baby loves the vibration setting, helps him fall asleep quickly! Also, the retractable side makes it so easy to get him in and out of the bassinet! Overall, I love the halo bassinet and it was worth the money. Will be good to keep for future babies as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the movements!
customer_reviews.text: My baby slept in this some as a newborn, but we use it mostly for diaper changes or to sit the boppy in (not recommended, but with supervision we do it). We love the heartbeat sounds and vibration. I especially loved the ability to move it however I needed - away from me or close by! I will keep this thing forever and I’ll recommend to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet was so slanted that my baby would slide to one side! Not safe!!! For the amount of money we paid for this it should not have been this way. Luckily we were able to return it. We ended up getting a $90 bassinet from target and it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Arch

customer_reviews.title: Mold all over the Bassinest
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't tell you how disappointed I was when I received this for my son. The box got delivered in a big rain storm and had holes in it (Which might not have been the fault of the product) But when I opened it up inside my house, A musty smell emanated and the bassinest had mold all over it. I was horrified and took it outside as quickly as I brought it in (I didn't want this near my son). I wrapped it up with plastic bags and put it back in the box and left it outside. I shipped it back the next day. Go with Graco Sense2Snooze Bassinet, We were so much happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard DiGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Love the adjustable hight of this bassinet (our bed is ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the adjustable hight of this bassinet (our bed is quite high) and the swivel action. I can bring the baby really close to me (face to face) and almost feel like we are sleeping in the same bed (can see and hear him), without the potential dangers of doing so. Can hold hands and fetch the pacy without having to prop myself up, or lift my head off the pillow. It is pretty heavy and feels very sturdy. Could have done without all the fancy features, my little one did not take to any of them, except the sound of the heartbeat. WiIl miss it when he grows out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: these people sell based on a story,  terrible design and build
customer_reviews.text: i owned two of these and they both have the same design and build flaw. they will sagg to one side due to cheap construction and unless your baby is sleeping with head to the uphill side of it you will run into unnecessary reflux issues with your child due to the poor design and cheap build of this product. they sell this based on a sad story and preaching. if you ask me the guy who crashed the ship shouldn't design the next one.
customer_reviews.author: OTS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and the swivel is so helpful
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a true review, since baby is not yet here, but we love the design and expect great things from this bassinet! The swivel is excellent, as it doesn't just rotate horizontally, it's capable of more like a circle and a side-to-side. Super sturdy and stays completely still if you aren't moving it yourself though. Only drawback is that the base is too heavy to cart it into the living room, so I'll have to find a portable bassinet for moving around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Great mommy assisting bassinet!
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet definitely addresses all of the basic needs of an infant. With the different variations of sound and vibration it makes soothing an infant and easy task. I especially love that the side collapses so that I can scoop my daughter out and lay her down with minimal effort from a seated position on my bed. If halo were asking how to improve their product I would definitely suggest that they add rollers so that the entire unit can be moved. And I would also suggest a locking bassinet swivel feature so that older siblings can't entertain themselves by spinning the infant around.
customer_reviews.author: C Leffall Rog

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: Just buy it! It’s PERFECT! Minimal getting out of bed Storage for diapers and wipes Swivels and bends for easy reaching Also the breathable mesh is awesome Music and heart beat noise which my baby loves! Vibrate is strong my baby doesn’t care too much for anymore The only con I say it that it is a little bulky the legs are very wide. But the pros outweigh it times 10!!
customer_reviews.author: rosa

customer_reviews.title: Must have bassinet.
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for my third baby... wish I had it for my first two. The ability to move / swivel the bassinet makes this so convenient. The side silently compressing when you go to lay down or pick up baby is another amazing feature. Love that you can lower and raise it with one simple screw. The other bassinets I’ve used you have to lower / raise each individual leg. I can’t speak much to the vibration, lights etc. because my older sons played with the buttons and killed the batteries so quickly and I’ve never put new ones in because I didn’t feel the need. This is a must have for any new mom!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Lovingit!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the halo. I did a big research base on my friends bassinest, and for me this one was the best. I have it right beside my bed, I can see through, my baby enjoy the music and the white noise, but he can sleep without it. He doesn’t enjoy too much the vibrate thing. Something that I love a lot is the nursery alarm, because it will wake you up if you fell asleep with you baby on your arms. It is a big piece of thing on your room, but is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Majami

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly and not level
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to have this bassinet, however, there are more negatives than positives IMHO. Firstly- it is very heavy. I have RA and can't move anything as is, so I am unable to move this by myself. Second, it is not level. Baby would keep rolling into the side, my husband tried to level it out, but as soon as you move the swivel, it's uneven again. The bucket part is very wobbly and moves when baby does. Our LO is now 5 months, and when he kicks around, the bucket keeps moving. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love halo
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love halo since it seemed like the solution for safe sleeping for my newborn. Pro: safe, flat surface which is recommended by pediatricians. Swivel is nice, easy convenient light for allowing you to peek on baby. Con: heavy, clunky, difficult to move around it in a 1400 sq food condo, baby seemed to slide to one side because the swivel made it uneven, baby hated being on a hard fat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We got our first one delivered to the front door and it arrived quickly. When unboxing, I could hear something rolling around in the swivel portion. When I took that cover off, one screw from the center pivot had stripped out and the plastic center pivot was cracked. We had to ship it back and due to the baby being born I had to buy the next one from a local store. Once assembled it functions great and is a time saver when trying to get a little more sleep from each night.
customer_reviews.author: Sitting by the pool

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, vibration/sound unit needs work
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice bassinet. One star off because you have to crawl under the bassinet and use a tiny screw driver to remove the vibration/sound component thing to replace the batteries (which will die every four weeks if you use those functions on a nightly basis). MAJOR design flaw and the last thing you want to do when sleep deprived and physically exhausted, in your dark bedroom, having just spent an hour and a half getting baby to go to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that the height adjust and that I ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a five star if it weren’t for the fact that my son hates it. I love the fact that the height adjust and that I can swivel him toward me in bed but he seems to hate it. There isn’t much padding to it and seems to be uncomfortable in it so we’ve gone back to the rock n play for now. Will use this again before trying to transition to his crib.
customer_reviews.author: Erinn Aubry

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy, overrated and pushed/marketed but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The issue I had with this is the weight of the base. I smashed my toe on it multiple times. There are features like music or sounds which are unnecessary if you have a smartphone or any other baby product because they all seem to come with these features. In my opinion this bassinet was way overpriced. Some others that travel well, can be easily relocated and have a zip down side that puts your baby at bed height safely are a better investment.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. 1st baby - Didn’t realize how convenient this would make night time sleeps. Swivel allows you to pull right up to bed. You can feed, rock, give pacifier without getting out of bed. Can move/swivel angle of bassinet easily if your daytime monitor needs to see bassinet from a specific angle. Heavy product base- hard to move but very secure. Won’t tip over. Would be great if it was slightly more mobile ( perhaps wheels, can be moved around the room) but the strong base is worth it. Your baby will be safe and secure if set up correctly. Set up was simple- easy if you have a drill.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for c section mamas
customer_reviews.text: I had this right next to my bed and would swivel it around to rest right next to me on the bed while sleeping. Made it very easy for me to tend to him in the middle of the night. Only downside is it shakes a lot if it's standing on its own. Once I'd swivel it back off the bed if the baby moved the whole bassinet would shake and wake the baby.
customer_reviews.author: SharlineB

customer_reviews.title: Very large but looks like it will work well
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used it yet so can’t really rate on sleep quality, but it is very large so will take up space in your room. Rocking feature doesn’t quite work. Vibration feature is not quiet. Bar doesn’t come down easy to get baby in and out. Also there are no wheels on this one, so not easy to move base which is good for sleeping baby, easy to move swivel if needed to go to the bathroom at night. Will write another review once used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very large and HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality with awesome features. Love this bassinet for next to my bedside. Perfect height. However, I was not prepared for how heavy this bassinet is. It is super HEAVY. It cannot easily be moved around. The legs on the bottom also come out really far and take up a lot of room. If you want to move it to another room the legs have to come off because they cannot fit through a doorway. I wish I had seen this bassinet in person before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: abbey

customer_reviews.title: We loved it but honestly only used it for about two ...
customer_reviews.text: We loved it but honestly only used it for about two months... I think if you don’t mind the price is great for the first days at home when you are waking up every hour or two... baby liked the music and vibration 😊
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My baby doesn’t sleep on this. It’s a good bed to wake up the baby but not put the baby to sleep. A regular 20 dollar baby shaker bed works 10 times better. Will be giving this as a gift to my friend. Wish the thing does more for the money like recline the bed and able to shake the bed.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and sent for my new grandson. Daughter and son-in-law live it. Sleep saver...for mom and dad! Can keep baby “right there” without the threat of rolling over on the baby. Easy to access, feed, and change baby without getting up through the night. Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Not to buy it
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this product at all!! Don't buy it. This is the first bad review I out on Amazon. My baby rolls to the side and to the top her head is touching it and it is not paded!! She is not even 2 months. I thing once the baby passes 8 pounds the Halo can't support it. Today I fell asleep in the living room and she was in the Greco pack and play she sleeped so much better and longer.
customer_reviews.author: David Malitsky

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the hype
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this bassinet for months and wanted to love it, but I wish I would have listened to the other reviews. It was uneven and rocked even though it wasn’t supposed to. I thought we could fix the issues with appropriate assembly, but if it was level and secure it wouldn’t swivel. I’m so thankful we could return it and I ordered the Arms Reach. It is much more stable and my 2 month old has been sleeping in it well.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Pittman

customer_reviews.title: but if that's what it takes to make it sturdy, carry on
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd had this for my first kid. It was so reassuring to have my baby so near my face while not having to have him in my bed with me. The base is bulky and a bit awkward, but if that's what it takes to make it sturdy, carry on. The press-down side was a little stiffer than I expected but it doesn't change my opinion. If anything, for me, it was a blessing because my daughter couldn't easily pull it down.
customer_reviews.author: Heather A. Gunnerson

customer_reviews.title: Well though out product.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with our Halo Bassinest. Our daughter sleeps like a champ in this thing. It feels very sturdy and moves fluidly on the swivel/arm. The base is pretty heavy, but that's clearly by design and puts your mind at ease that this thing will not tip over. The little light that's in there is genius, but it's near impossible to find in the dark. Only thing I'd change is making the buttons glow or easier to find in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy box!!
customer_reviews.text: Got the bassinet in a rather large box, and it was stupid heavy to carry up the stairs (my husband graciously did, because I am due any day now!!) The instructions are very straightforward, but read them all the way through before you start assembling!! I snapped some pieces into place before I should have, which lead to assembly taking longer than it should have. It really is an easy process, just not for me! Hah! Seems very sturdy and comfy, just need a baby to put in it and it'll be complete!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I personally did not like this item at all. It was super inconvenient, very heavy, and not worth the price at all. It’s insanely hard to move , especially from room to room at all without straining yourself. The legs are huge and if you have limited space in your bedroom , be prepared to trip on it . The legs are also pretty thick so if you have a low bed frame , forget about it being a useful co-sleeper. Personally did not like it . I did appreciate the mesh walls and nightlight . That’s it .
customer_reviews.author: MichelleVK

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed in the quality of this product
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that for this price, I am disappointed in the quality of this product. It comes with a super thin, cheap mattress and a plastic, crinkly mattress cover that I can't imagine any baby sleeping comfortably on. It also doesn't come with any accessories whatsoever- every little add-on, like a mobile, mattress, sheet, etc., needs to be purchased separately. For this price, I had higher expectations. It's basically a glorified crib on a stand.
customer_reviews.author: Katharina Howard

customer_reviews.title: I would go with a less expensive model - the gadgets here need improvement
customer_reviews.text: It tended to slant a bit, which makes baby slide. Love the adjustable height , the light is doable, but could be a bit more. Seems a bit wobbly - even with adjustments. Like the mesh sides and the “side door” I give it 3 stars for the concept of it - but needs improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Mothershopper

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Electronics
customer_reviews.text: After only 8 months of ownership and 4 months of real use, the battery powered vibration and music feature no longer works. I have attempted to troubleshoot with no avail. SO MAD. For such an expensive item this should NOT happen!
customer_reviews.author: Marva

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Sleep Solution
customer_reviews.text: It is a beautifully built product however given its price (as much as an entry level crib) one has to consider value because it has a 20 lb weight limit which has given us just 4 months of use. Our baby slept well in it and I would reccomend it to those parents whose budgets are not impacted by spending this sum on something that can only be used for a limited time.
customer_reviews.author: Providence2000

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great bassinet. Our baby sleeps comfortably in it and ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great bassinet. Our baby sleeps comfortably in it and I love the swivel motion. It moves so easily that it doesn't wake him if I swivel it to get out of bed. It's like he's sleeping with us when we pull it close to the bed and the mesh sides make it very easy to see him. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is because the batteries for the music, light and vibration only last a few days. That's frustrating because we paid more for that function.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift and she loved it, great product.  Something great for the living room or master bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift and she used it everyday. Its stayed in the living room and she loved it. The baby even loved it, every time he was in it, he was sleeping. Easy to put together and a great design. Will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J.

customer_reviews.title: Tilts.  Junk.  Returned.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a let down. I brought my baby home from the hospital and just like people said, the bassinet tilted significantly and my baby rolled over in it right away. The features like vibration and lights didn’t work. I wish I would have listened to the reviews before purchasing. We ended up having a sleepless few days trying to figure out what she could comfortably sleep in since the crib is too big for our room.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Loved this for my newborn. The light feature is great, just enough for night time feeding. The noise option was okay but the vibrate is very minimal. Though I didnt use the 2 options overall a great bassinet. Love that I could just look over to see my newborn and not have to get up and look over the side.
customer_reviews.author: kayla Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Parents' best friend
customer_reviews.text: This is a godsend for us! Love the swivel! Let's me see baby at any position and the mesh let's me see through the bassinet. I use the nightlight constantly and it doesn't see to disrupt baby at all. He likes the heartbeat option best, but the music is nice too. He doesn't much like the vibration feature, but other babies might.
customer_reviews.author: Razzie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible, bought this back in January, baby arrived in may and the return window closed in April so I can't return it. From the first time we put my son in it there was so much slop in the pivoting mechanics that we could never get the bed flat. We constantly battled him rolling to one side up against the side that was down hill. I would never buy this product again, for the price I would expect better quality but this was honestly a pile of garbage. I would give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: D Ro

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.. manufacturing errors?
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. We got this bassinet with high hopes as it is a popular choice and comes highly recommended. I have two major issues with it. The bassinet itself is not level so our newborn slides to the side regardless of how it is swiveled. Secondly, the control panel is too close to the mesh so if she turns her head with any force she smacks her head on the plastic control panel. Pros: swivel feature, mesh sides push down side to help get her out while laying in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and low key
customer_reviews.text: It takes up very little room and does the job well
customer_reviews.author: James Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This has made it easy. Also the drop down side is awesome so ...
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet has been a lifesaver for me. I ended up with some nerve damage after delivery of our child and had trouble getting in and out of bed especially with anything in the way. This has made it easy. Also the drop down side is awesome so you don't have to reach over top to lift baby out. In hindsight we probably could have gone with the model that doesn't have vibrate, music, nursing timer as we don't use those functions much. It's also great to be able to see through the mesh sides and see baby.
customer_reviews.author: KN85

customer_reviews.title: NO INSTRUCTIONS and missing screws.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst thing I have ever ordered from Amazon. For the price you pay, totally not worth it. 1. The box came totally damaged. 2. There were no instructions. 3. Missing 2 screws. 4. As I was screwing in the legs, LOUD crack and the cover popped up and wouldn't go back down. Totally not worth the price. Save your money and get a regular $50 bassinet.
customer_reviews.author: Armen Kash

customer_reviews.title: Missing fitted sheet
customer_reviews.text: On the Halo website, it states that a fitted sheet is included. A Halo rep confirmed this on the phone as well, but my Bassinest did not come with a fitted sheet which was disappointing. Other than that, the bassinest functions well. It's really heavy so it's not a good choice if you need to move this between rooms.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderA

customer_reviews.title: Not for my baby
customer_reviews.text: The design of this bassinet is flawless, I absolutely loved the idea of it. My little one doesn't like to sleep flat, and really took to her swing instead, so unfortunately we were not able to get any use out of this and I ended up selling it. I also don't like that it's flat, because there were several times that my baby would spit up and if she were not in an elevated position, the spit up had nowhere to go, which made me worry that she might choke.
customer_reviews.author: Adriane

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. You can raise and lower it to whatever your bed height is. It swivels so you can move it away from the bed to get up. It’s worth the money. You also need the infant insert to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, convenient, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice and sturdy bassinet. The mattress pad is firm. The swivel design is great and swivels smoothly to you while in your bed. The wall of the bassinet comes down to help you get your hands underneath baby. One negative is that the feet take up a ton of floor space.
customer_reviews.author: medstud123

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son & daughter in-laws first baby. Set up was easy & she said all was functioning well. Baby hasn’t arrived but their pup jumped in it & it didn’t move so I would say puppy tested & strong
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the bassinet
customer_reviews.text: I like the bassinet, but I would have gone with a simpler (cheaper) version in hindsight. We never use any of the "bells and whistles" like the sound machine, vibrator, etc.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Not level!
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly designed. My newborn was laid flat on her back. Within a matter of a minute she had rolled to her side. It was at that point I realized the bed was slanted causing the baby to roll. I immediately purchased a different product. This item was put together per the instructions and still was not level.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hipp

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product over all ..sleek, great design, durable, extra secure with leg support system. Breathable netting. Cons large spread x like base to support the Bassinet (can hide half under bed) Side bar/easy access for moms feeding is awkward and doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: AHOFFMAN

customer_reviews.title: Soooo glad we bought this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great bassinet! Love the 360 turn capability and soft wall. Makes middle of the night endeavors easier. The sound and light capabilities are very handy and get used daily. Glad I bought the upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged and with missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new product and one of the parts came cracked and 2 screws were missing. The packaging inside was also damaged. I am disappointed. I expected better quality check for $200+ Bassinet
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Great bassinet!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter enjoys having her baby girl so close to her. It’s like having the infant next to you in bed, but much safer. Her baby girl moves toward her in the night, but the mesh sides keep her safe.
customer_reviews.author: Shar Dod

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with bassinest and customer service
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I was contacted by Halo customer service and they are replacing the soothing center. Waited a few days for their response but otherwise they have made the replacement process super easy. My daughter loves the bassinest and with the replacement of the soothing center we are very happy. The soothing center stopped working within the first month of use. Would expect better from such a reputable company and for the high price point. I’ve been waiting two days to hear back from customer service. Will update my review once I hear back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Brailey

customer_reviews.title: Vibration Piece Faulty
customer_reviews.text: I gave this bassinet as a gift to my son & daughter in law. After only 2 months of use, the batteries don't stay connected because the lid doesn't close properly. Therefore, it shuts off until you unscrew the battery compartment & realign the batteries. Also, it sounds like the motor that vibrates may be loose as it is very loud. They are working on contacting the manufacturer, but have had no luck to date.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda C.

customer_reviews.title: Base potential hazard as it extends outward
customer_reviews.text: The base extends outward very long, understandably to provide the proper support. However, it does not tuck under the bed so neatly and out of the way as it is described. In fact, I/we felt it poses a hazard when getting out of the bed and beginning to walk. Also, the mattress pad that comes standard with the Bassinest is very cheap feeling
customer_reviews.author: aquacode

customer_reviews.title: Great for preemie babies!
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, and arrived before expected, which was great, since the newborn arrived before expected! This has been a saving grace for new parents (most appreciated is the heartbeat sound feature) and especially great for pre-term babies who need extra soothing and are too tiny for bigger cribs!
customer_reviews.author: SuzySez

customer_reviews.title: Great product, battery life not so much
customer_reviews.text: Love how the bassinet swivels so I can have my little one close to me while sleeping safely but the battery life for the features such as the vibration and light is awful. I don’t even use the features that often and I’m still constantly changing the batteries. I’m at the point where I’ve just stopped replacing the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Scott

customer_reviews.title: Tall; great height!
customer_reviews.text: It extends extra tall! I was worried about the height of our bed since we have a full box spring and mattress. I'm 5'3" and have to push off with my toes to sit on the bed. The Halo Swivel bassinet allows the mattress portion to rest on top of my mattress and could even allow a pillow-topper under it, as well. Night time feeds will be much easier this time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bassinet is really nice quality I wish my baby would have liked it
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet is really nice quality I wish my baby would have liked it. It plays music and vibrates and has a light etc. it is fancy but he just did not like it the mattress did seem pretty stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Uneven, save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! As other reviewers have mentioned, the bassinet is uneven causing our baby to roll towards the front of the bassinet against the front control panel. I was a sucker for the swivel but can’t use that feature as I have to stuff pillows underneath the front in order to level it out for our 2 month old to sleep comfortably. Also, the bassinet isn’t tall enough to hover over our master bed as our frame is to high. While this is not Halo’s fault it is something other Mom’s should be aware of. All in all... this was definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Love! Such a great bedside bassinet
customer_reviews.text: Love! Such a great bedside bassinet. The *only* thing I would change is if you could lock it in to place to stop the swivel. Sometimes it is in a perfect position and would be nice to hit a button and lock it and then unlock when ready to move again. If this function is on it we haven't found it yet or any instructions on how to :)
customer_reviews.author: Stzout

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first baby. It has so many options and is adjustable so she can be right next to me and easily accessible for nighttime wake ups. It moves easily every which way and is also nice and stable. I bought some bassinet sheets that fit and it looks so cute! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Bramer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bassinet.
customer_reviews.text: Pick up a few extra sheets if you buy this bassinet. Your baby will spit up and it's good to have a few extras. Also it took a few nights for my LO to get used to it, but eventually he settled in nicely. The LED lights are very bright so I put a piece of terry cloth to dim them a bit. In a dark room they are way too bright to shine in his eyes. The vibrate feature definitely helps when you just feed your baby @ 2am and need them to calm down. Works like a charm..
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Love the swivel!
customer_reviews.text: At first, our baby did not like this bassinest... but after a few changes to our routine, all is good! The swivel is a great feature. Nightlight, Vibration and white noise options are helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Not a good night's rest
customer_reviews.text: The mattress is non existent and the sleeping area, which should be flat, is slightly curved, leaving the baby to slide to the side and potentially cause a dangerous situation. Otherwise, cute and could have been convenient
customer_reviews.author: SoGo

customer_reviews.title: Our baby boy loved the bassinet It was cost and warm My baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Our baby boy loved the bassinet It was cost and warm My baby slept in it till 5,5 months and then we really had to move him to his crib. The 360 swivel option is really handy when they wake up and you quickly want to get to them
customer_reviews.author: D.09

customer_reviews.title: Better than other bassinets
customer_reviews.text: We love it the only bad thing is that it does not have something on the top (like a toy) so the babe can get distracted, movement is not that smooth but it is still a good item
customer_reviews.author: Fide Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Hard mattress
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice, but mattress is hard. Our baby didn’t like it, and would only sleep maybe at max 2hrs in the halo. It’s convenient because it swivels and the side comes down. The vibration is not enough to make any difference. We ended not using this and buying a Snoo. Which was a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Fetner

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wasted money on this thing. The battery compartment has to come unscrewed with a screw driver so when the batteries wear out it’s a pain to maintain. I also think the pouches on the side are a design flaw. Forgetting to Velcro them back could potentially pose a risk and they don’t really close anything in. The music is nice but our baby doesn’t really react to that or the vibrations. The nursing timer isn’t needed for me and the fladhlight is so weak I can’t see anything. I’d still buy a Halo but for us this model has too many bells and whistles we don’t find useful.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality design making it unsafe for a baby!
customer_reviews.text: Once the baby was born on March 1, 2020 we found the product design is defective. The basinet is not level when the baby is in it. It is not safe! The company will not fix the flaw. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Even the company doesn’t stand by it!
customer_reviews.author: TE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for my newborn!!
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet has been amazing for our baby. I love how it swivels and it helped me pick up my baby and get in and out of bed during my recovery. It also has great additional features such as the vibration, songs and a nightlight. To change the batteries with these features does require patience though as you have to unscrew the box from the bottom. Overall- I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Happy Baby, Happy Mama
customer_reviews.text: Our hospital recommended the Halo after they had tested them in their newborn wing. Our baby is happy and sleeps great. Mama is happy having her baby right next to her without having to co-sleep in the bed. Product hits all the point we were looking for in a bassinet. Would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Love this bassinet. We have a very high bed and this bassinet meets its height with room to go. I love the swivel effect it has and the lay down front section. I had a csection and this helped a lot for easy safe mobility of our child.
customer_reviews.author: Neshaya Randall

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mommies
customer_reviews.text: Its a great and convenient product for moms, but it's expensive. I wish I could wash the outer lining cloth, but it doesn't come off. Another thing is the cushion is very thin. My baby did not sleep in the here long, but like I said it was convenient for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Bria Simone

customer_reviews.title: Yes, but actually  no
customer_reviews.text: Yes, but actually no. Baby doesn't sleep in it. When I placed it near bed, it was hard to get to it for easy access. So, yes, but no.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I used this until my daughter was 3 months and she slept wonderfully (for an infant)! I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystah Carter

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable height and swivel lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: We liked it for the adjustable height and the swivel sometimes beds aren’t just one size fits all and the adjustable height really helps and the swivel helps bring the baby closer to you. As far as the vibration, lights, lullabies and nursing timer it never really worked for longer than a few times and then would stop we just gave up on that part it could have just been the batteries we used but we didn’t really need them anyways
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. Feels pretty sturdy and swivels without causing much sound. The height is adjusatable so you can set it to your bed height. There is a weight limit so you will need to eventually get a crib as your child gets bigger.
customer_reviews.author: babiesrfatTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Problem was sold with errors from the manufacturer. One out of the 4 stands didnt have a preset hole for the screw to tighten into. You cant trust a baby product company that fails in their quality checks.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these one for my brother and his wife and one for my husbands sister and husband both say it is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: raquel beayon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This bassinet is absolutely worth the money, my baby has been sleeping in it for almost 5 weeks now and I haven’t had any problems. I know that all babies are different and will prefer different things but this one definitely works for us. I also loves that it comes with a night light, I use it at every night time feeding.. amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

product_meta.title: HALO BassiNest Swivel Sleeper, Bedside Bassinet, Soothing Center with Nightlight, Vibration and Sound, Premiere Series, Herringbone
product_meta.description: Style:Bassinet| Color:Herringbone"Make your transition into motherhood as easy as possible. The Halo bassinets swivel Sleeper is the only bassinet that rotates 360 degrees for the ultimate in convenience and safety. Now your little one can sleep as close as you'd like, while still in their own sleep area, reducing the safety risks associated with bed-sharing. In addition to bringing baby close, it swivels to make getting in and out of bed hassle-free. The patented lowering bedside wall makes it easy for you to scoop up baby for cuddles or nursing without the need to get out of bed. The premiere series includes a soothing center with Nightlights, four soothing sounds, and two levels of vibration. Its stable, adjustable base fits under almost any bed. Recommended for babies up to five months of age or 20lbs. Use should be discontinued when infant shows signs of pulling up, rolling over, pushing up to kneeling position. Mattress is waterproof and contains no toxic flame retardants. Independently tested to meet or exceed all U.S. Consumer products Safety Commission and health Canada safety standards for bassinets. Jpma certified. Includes 100% polyester coordinated fitted sheet. Wipes clean with a damp cloth. Sheet is machine washable. Safety reminder: never use Soft bedding such as loose blankets, bumpers, pillows, and positioners in the bassinets. The American Academy of Pediatrics suggests the use of wearable blankets to keep your baby warm."
feature_bullets: Our best-selling HALO BassiNest, now with a new, improved design and available in two new Modern prints: Herringbone and Pebble. Also includes waterproof mattress and one fitted sheet.
Swivels and rotates 360 degrees to bring baby to you for close, safe sleep and to make getting in and out of bed hassle-free. Includes storage pockets to keep baby's essentials close by.
Patented lowering bedside wall allows you to tend to baby from bed. Wall can be locked in the upright position, if desired

Improved soothing center includes two levels of vibration, and four soothing sounds to help relax baby for sleep. Also includes amber nightlight and floorlight to help you see without disturbing your baby or partner.
New sleek base easily adjusts for bed heights from 22" - 34". Base legs tuck under bed and require only 32" clearance from wall, making it ideal for small spaces.

specifications.Safety warning: Safety Reminder: Never use soft bedding such as loose blankets, bumpers, pillows, and positioners in the Bassinest. The American Academy of Pediatrics suggests the use of wearable blankets to keep your baby warm.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars35 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
